ygData.subject: Cantera for Mac OS X
ygData.msgSnippet: The latest version of the Cantera source distribution (http://blue.caltech.edu/cantera_dist/1.3.5/src/cantera-1.3.tar.gz) now builds out of the box on Mac OS

The latest version of the Cantera source distribution
(http://blue.caltech.edu/cantera_dist/1.3.5/src/cantera-1.3.tar.gz)
now builds 'out of the box' on Mac OS X, as well as on linux.

I have successfully built it on a G4 running OS X 10.2 using g++ and
g77. Other configurations may also work. The Cantera Python interface
works fine with the version of Python that comes preinstalled with OS
X 10.2, provided you first install the 'Numeric' package. 

For some reason, the Python that Apple distributes does not include
Tk, so MixMaster can't be used. But you can get a version of Python
from Fink (http://fink.sourceforge.net) that includes Tk, and
MixMaster works with this version with no problem. (To view reaction
path diagrams, you also need to get Graphviz. See 
http://www.phil.uu.nl/~js/graphviz/)

The Matlab toolbox does not currently work on the Mac. It looks like
it will require some rewriting to port the MEX files. 

Please let me know if you run into any problems building Cantera on a
Mac, or if you have suggestions.

DG
